summary: In this context, ethylbenzene is categorized as one of the volatile organic compounds (VOCs) within the BTEX group, which are known to exert serious adverse effects on environmental air quality. The text highlights the public health risks associated with exposure to BTEX, including ethylbenzene, emphasizing the need to assess the toxic consequences of their combined presence, particularly regarding critical target organs. This indicates a direct relationship between ethylbenzene and adverse health effects due to its classification as a harmful VOC.
